WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for keeping us updated. I can confirm this will be fixed in the next release of the Visual Studio extension.
WorkItem.Description:
If you specify a TypeScriptOutDir then the compile on save will not work, but it will compile on build. I have tried the following:

* Use absolute path in TypeScriptOutDir 
* Use relative path in TypeScriptOutDir
* Use relative with project directory "$(ProjectDir)\script" as suggested on item [2101](https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/2101?ProjectName=typescript)
* With and without the js included in project

I am happy to provide more details if required.
WorkItem.Summary: Compile on save does not work with TypeScriptOutDir

Comments.Message:
I have made a mistake, this does work with absolute paths. It has also been fixed in a future release as stated on [2101](https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/2101?ProjectName=typescript), but I cannot use the workaround stated.

This ticket can now be closed.

I have now got the workaround working. This does not work:

$(ProjectDir)Script

But this does:

$(SolutionDir)Scripts
